name: Night Kingdom
desc: The Lord of the Night designed a realm of souls and memories to recreate the damaged Ley Lines in Natlan. The Night Kingdom is a mysterious, liminal space between the body and mind, life and death, where the souls of all the dead Natlanese go.

customize.name: Yohualtecuhtin, Lord of the Night
customize.desc: An angel who created the Night Kingdom in Natlan.

customize.text: The Lord of the Night created the Night Kingdom to recreate the Ley Lines' network when they were damaged.

customize.name: Ronova
customize.desc: The Ruler of Death, one of the Primordial One's Shades.

customize.text: The Ruler of Death helped Yohualtecuhtin to design the Night Kingdom and helped

customize.name: Xbalanque
customize.desc: The first Pyro Archon, who defeated the Flamelord and revived from the flames.

customize.text: to write down the rules of Natlan there: Ode of Resurrection and Pilgrimage of the Return of the Sacred Flame.

customize.name: Il Capitano
customize.desc: The First of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers and the Sentinel Knight of Khaenri'ah. His real name is Thrain.

customize.text: Capitano merged with the Lord of the Night to restore and change the Ley Lines in Natlan. Because of his immortality, the Night Kingdom can exist forever.

customize.name: Gosoythoth
customize.desc: A monster of the void, named Gosoythoth, "Reaper of the Abyss."

customize.text: The Abyss and its greatest weapon, Gosoythoth, went into the depths of the Night Kingdom to attack Natlan. From the Ley Lines, Gosoythoth extracted the memories of the fallen

customize.name: Xiuhcoatl
customize.desc: The Pyro Sovereign, defeated by the first Pyro Archon, Xbalanque. He faked his own death, after which the descendants of the ancient dragons could only bow before the throne and watch as their civilization inevitably faded away with each passing day.

customize.name: Lord of Eroded Primal Fire
customize.desc:
A fell dragon, congealed from the power of pitch-black darkness.

A monster of the void, known as both the Reaper of the Abyss and "Gosoythoth." It is able to corrupt memories contained within the ley lines of the earth, congealing them into tangible forces of catastrophic portent. From these memories that since time immemorial have flowed below the land, it has managed to extract the remnant will of a primordial elemental dragon sovereign, drawing it out like marrow to repurpose as the foundation of its own fabricated image.

But is it truly a mere "image"? Brought back by the very otherworldly forces it had once resisted, a once-dead dragon opens its eyes anew, forsaking all in this brief dream of a resurrection. Trapped perpetually in the final day of its existence by this pitch-black gospel, its boundless fury has consumed all reason. Now, what remains is its unrelenting lust for battle, burning on without end.

customize.name: Night Jade
customize.desc: A nearly weightless black jade, enveloped in chilling flames. According to Natlan's legends, offering it at a specific altar might just open the path to the kingdom ruled by the night.

customize.name: Shattered Night Jade
customize.desc: A nearly weightless black jade, enveloped in chilling flames. If it could be pieced together, perhaps something extraordinary might happen...

desc.text:
<color=#ffffffd9>(An ancient stone carving, with rough patterns cut into it by what appears to be a knife...)</color>
"I will leave the first knife mark here, to engrave the halls of this darkened world for those that come after me."
"This is where I make my first call to the night, that those who come after may summon from this departed world the glory of our ancestral spirits."
"Reach out, those who would follow in my footsteps..."
"And leave here your mark on history!"
<color=#ffffffd9>You see, appearing before your eyes... the figures of heroes who have come before.\nA man with flaming hair whose smile beams brightly, a travel-worn youth whose eyes smolder like the sunset, a child with an Iktomisaurus whose brow is furrowed in thought...\nAnd there, a familiar silhouette. She pauses but for the briefest of moments, then plunges resolutely into five hundred years of solitude.\nSome faces appear solemn, others mournful, while some still carry a flicker of anger, despite arriving at this place.\nYet without exception, they all stand there. Without exception, they have all ended up leaving "themselves" in this place...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Countless hands stretch out from the darkness, each clutching glowing stone feathers, passing them one by one into the distance.\nSome are swallowed by the darkness, but some still remain as unquenchable flames that adorn the curtain of night like stars.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>You know that these are "names." And one of them belongs to you.</color>
